intro: Pimpinella nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive veined pattern, giving it its scientific name. Pimpinella nervosa is often found in woodland edges and grassy areas, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
